column4: Help - my hard drive is sloooow after installing Lucid - It's a 7200rpm pata drive, and I can't enable dma - I think it's because it's using the new drivers that treats it as a scsi device - what should I do?
those drivers have been used in ubuntu since a lot of releases
okay. but what can I do?
are you sure the dma is off ?
yes. hdparm says so. Also, I/O is 16 bit
I can't do anything because hdparm won't play with scsi devices
see if demsg say why they were configured like that
at least you should see [    0.495386] ata5.01: configured for UDMA/133 <<< tha's for my only pata disk
I think it's as good as it gets....I think the problem is that it's swapping because of too little ram
